Flumplenook (noun): A person who is always getting themselves into strange or unexpected situations, often due to their own clumsiness or lack of forethought.
Snurfle (verb): To engage in a heated argument or debate, often over something trivial or inconsequential.
Jinkle (verb): To nervously fidget or twiddle with something, often due to boredom or anxiety.
Glibble (verb): To speak in an overly dramatic or exaggerated manner, often to gain attention or sympathy.
Floopnose (noun): A person who is extremely clumsy or accident-prone, often causing chaos and destruction wherever they go.
